alert.note: Alert for Assumption; East Baton Rouge; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Southern Livingston; St. James; West Baton Rouge; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 5:22PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Ascension, St. James, West Baton Rouge, southwestern Livingston, Iberville, southwestern East Baton Rouge and north central Assumption Parishes through 545 PM CDT... At 521 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Baker to Inniswold to near Whitehall. Movement was southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Gonzales, Donaldsonville, Plaquemine, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Gramercy, Addis, Lutcher, Brusly, White Castle, Sorrento, French Settlement, Rosedale, Port Vincent, Grosse Tete, Westminster, Geismar and Erwinville. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 130 and 195. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Assumption; East Baton Rouge; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Southern Livingston; St. James; West Baton Rouge; Western Ascension
